page.title: 15Poultry Farm, Martock
page.content: This chicken farm owned by Hebditch is one of the largest in the country. It has over 40,000 chicks of which half of them (the males) get gassed, processed, then fed to other animals at zoos. The males are the darker coloured birds. The males are thrown into a bin. The ones at the bottom suffercate and die before they are gassed. Bad eggs are thrown into another bin and some explode leaving a nasty smell. The female chicks are sold all over the country to farmers for egg laying. The chicks although good egg producers do not put on enough weight for them to be sold for the table. This is why it is not economical for them to keep the males. They have 8 incubators and they stay in these for about 25 days. The farm also own some land which is used to grow crops, mainly barley and wheat.
